SEARCH
Package me.mapokapo.features.matches

Class Match

java.lang.Object
me.mapokapo.features.matches.Match
public class Match extends Object
This class represents a match between two teams. The match is not started by default. You must call the start() method to start the match.
Since:
1.0
Author:
Leo PetroviÄ‡

    Match(int id, Team homeTeam, Team awayTeam)
    Constructs a new match with the given ID, home team, and away team.

  • Constructor Details

    • Match

      public Match(int id, Team homeTeam, Team awayTeam)
      Constructs a new match with the given ID, home team, and away team.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier for this match.
      homeTeam - The home team of the match.
      awayTeam - The away team of the match.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the home team and away team are the same or have the same ID.

  • Method Details

    • setScore

      public void setScore(int homeScore, int awayScore)
      Sets the absolute score for the match.
      Parameters:
      homeScore - The score of the home team.
      awayScore - The score of the away team.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the match has not started yet.
      IllegalStateException - If the match has already finished.
      IllegalArgumentException - If the score is negative.

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the match.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the match has already finished.
      IllegalStateException - If the match has already started.

    • finish

      public void finish()
      Finishes the match.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the match has not started yet.
      IllegalStateException - If the match has already finished.
